channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10830] Integration test MR jobs attempt to load htrace jars from the wrong location
item.description:
The MapReduce jobs submitted by IntegrationTestImportTsv want to load the htrace JAR from the local Maven cache but get confused and use a HDFS URI.

Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 2, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 8.489 sec <<< FAILURE!

testGenerateAndLoad(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.IntegrationTestImportTsv)  Time elapsed: 0.488 sec  <<< ERROR!

java.io.FileNotFoundException: File does not exist: hdfs://localhost:37548/home/apurtell/.m2/repository/org/cloudera/htrace/htrace-core/2.04/htrace-core-2.04.jar

        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem$17.doCall(DistributedFileSystem.java:1110)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem$17.doCall(DistributedFileSystem.java:1102)

        at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystemLinkResolver.resolve(FileSystemLinkResolver.java:81)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem.getFileStatus(DistributedFileSystem.java:1102)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.filecache.ClientDistributedCacheManager.getFileStatus(ClientDistributedCacheManager.java:288)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.filecache.ClientDistributedCacheManager.getFileStatus(ClientDistributedCacheManager.java:224)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.filecache.ClientDistributedCacheManager.determineTimestamps(ClientDistributedCacheManager.java:93)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.filecache.ClientDistributedCacheManager.determineTimestampsAndCacheVisibilities(ClientDistributedCacheManager.java:57)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobSubmitter.copyAndConfigureFiles(JobSubmitter.java:264)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobSubmitter.copyAndConfigureFiles(JobSubmitter.java:300)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.JobSubmitter.submitJobInternal(JobSubmitter.java:387)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Job$10.run(Job.java:1268)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Job$10.run(Job.java:1265)

        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)

        at javax.security.auth.Subject.doAs(Subject.java:415)

        at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.doAs(UserGroupInformation.java:1491)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Job.submit(Job.java:1265)

        at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Job.waitForCompletion(Job.java:1286)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.ImportTsv.run(ImportTsv.java:603)

        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:70)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportTsv.doMROnTableTest(TestImportTsv.java:270)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportTsv.doMROnTableTest(TestImportTsv.java:232)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.IntegrationTestImportTsv.testGenerateAndLoad(IntegrationTestImportTsv.java:206)
item.summary: Integration test MR jobs attempt to load htrace jars from the wrong location

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Or vice versa, want to load a jar from the distributed cache, but use a path to the desired artifact in the user's local Maven cache instead.
Ping stack - who over there is looking at htrace stuff these days?
Also affects IntegrationTestBigLinkedList
And IntegrationTestWithCellVisibilityLoadAndVerify. All of the integration tests that submit MR jobs I expect.
Probably clear from the stacktrace in the OP, but in case not, this problem occurs when the tests are run in local mode.
htrace package name changed from org.cloudera.htrace to org.htrace. The version was upped from 2.04 to 3.0.3. Any idea why we'd still be referring to old htrace? Is it found in the classpath here?

htrace package name changed from org.cloudera.htrace to org.htrace. The version was upped from 2.04 to 3.0.3.

Not in 0.98 branch. From pom.xml:

      <dependency>

        <groupId>org.cloudera.htrace</groupId>

        <artifactId>htrace-core</artifactId>

        <version>${htrace.version}</version>

      </dependency>

    </dependencies>

where htrace.version is defined as 2.04.
Ok. I didn't touch that (smile). This worked? Trunk seems to work though it likes killing all servers in cluster. You got your fancy bisect rig over there Andrew to see where stuff broke?
Thought I'd try updating package and version references first. Will report back.
Or, let me try a 0.98 RC over here first....

It works standalone for me Andrew w/ the RC:

hbase-0.98.1-hadoop2 stack$ ./bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestsDriver -r .IntegrationTestImportTsv.

...

Time: 39.072

OK (2 tests)

On cluster it fails but for another reason – looking for a dir that does not exist... need to dig in why:

Tue Mar 25 15:06:58 PDT 2014, org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.RpcRetryingCaller@363fcfd9, java.io.FileNotFoundException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: File file:/home/stack/target/test-data/885c83ca-4620-4cbb-adb9-81a094811271/IntegrationTestImportTsv-c9d8e609-7797-4dee-8433-2493ee7540c1/hfiles/d/3ebd3472282d4d0dbdea4c19d21d9340 does not exist

Interesting, I'm doing "mvn -DskipTests clean install && cd hbase-it && mvn verify" aka. "mvn failsafe:integration-test", but I may have run the latter command from the root directory the last time around. Let me try this again. Will close these issues as Invalid if it checks out.
Still seeing this. To reproduce "mvn -DskipTests clean install && cd hbase-it && mvn verify"

Using the "hbase" script and IntegrationTestsDriver to execute the test does work if run against a separately launched all-localhost local cluster, but that's not how we suggest IT tests be run: http://hbase.apache.org/book/hbase.tests.html, section 16.7.5.1
I can repro here. Let me look at it Andrew Purtell
Looks like this issue is in 0.98.0 and that if I go back to 0.96.0, I can't run the command-line pasted.

I can't run the command-line pasted.

You mean "mvn -DskipTests clean install && cd hbase-it && mvn verify"? This is what the online manual says to do to run hbase-it

Looks like this issue is in 0.98.0

Could easily be so, IIRC I only used IntegrationTestsDriver against a cluster last time.

Issue is in 0.96.x too if I pass hadoop2 profile (I get NPE trying to start datanodes in minidfs if I pass no profile; i.e. we use hadoop1). So, this is an old issue probably not worth sinking an RC for but we should fix it.

So, this is an old issue probably not worth sinking an RC for but we should fix it.

Agree, doesn't make sense to sink a RC without a patch available first at least.

Rat hole.

The jobtracker filesystem is the localfs so comes time to figure whether to copy up the supporting jars in the JobSubmitter, we think the target and the source filesystems the same so we do not copy them (even though 'default' fs is the mini hdfs this test sets up). The jobtracker picks up its fs from the setting of mapred.system.dir. Making mapred.system.dir be up in mini hdfs then has this issue whenever we ask Cluster its fs:


 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Wrong FS: hdfs://localhost:50007/mapred.system.dir, expected: file:///

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.checkPath(FileSystem.java:642)

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.makeQualified(FileSystem.java:462)

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FilterFileSystem.makeQualified(FilterFileSystem.java:114)

	at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.LocalJobRunner.getSystemDir(LocalJobRunner.java:741)

	at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Cluster$1.run(Cluster.java:163)

	at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Cluster$1.run(Cluster.java:161)

	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)

	at javax.security.auth.Subject.doAs(Subject.java:415)

	at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.doAs(UserGroupInformation.java:1491)

	at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Cluster.getFileSystem(Cluster.java:161)

	at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Job.submit(Job.java:1264)

...

If I banged my head harder I should be able to figure out some workaround but putting aside for a now so maybe a Nick Dimiduk or someone else who has been in here of late has chance to give input if they have any.

I'm taking the jar a spin on an 0.98.0++ cluster, run from the main. It's launching jobs okay but is getting stuck in #testRunFromOutputCommitter, something I'm not proud of. Since that part of HCat has gone the way of the dodo, I'm inclined to reassess that part of TableMapReduceUtil, especially if it's breaking on MR2/YARN.

Running from maven (mvn clean install -DskipTests && cd hbase-it && mvn failsafe:integration-test -Dit.test=IntegrationTestImportTsv), I get

Tests in error: 

  testGenerateAndLoad(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.IntegrationTestImportTsv): File does not exist: hdfs://localhost:33393/homes/hortonnd/.m2/repository/com/google/protobuf/protobuf-java/2.5.0/protobuf-java-2.5.0.jar

  testRunFromOutputCommitter(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.IntegrationTestImportTsv): File does not exist: hdfs://localhost:33393/homes/hortonnd/.m2/repository/com/google/protobuf/protobuf-java/2.5.0/protobuf-java-2.5.0.jar

Let me have a look.

We have been running the IT's on 0.98, but not with mvn verify which would run them on a mini cluster. Besides this, last time I tried running them also resulted in a lot of failures, by which point I had given up. These tests run for a long time, that's why we opted for now making them as a part of the normal unit test run. Maybe we should at least run them once per release to make sure they are still runnable as unit tests.

Nick Dimiduk Yeah, thats what I see only burps on htrace jar instead. Its mismatch of fs's it seems. We don't copy up the jars because the JobSubmitter thinks the jobtracker fs is same as that of the jars-to-copy-up so it skips on the copy.

This stuff ever work? I only went back as far as 0.96. It must have worked against 0.94 else we'd not have stuck it in the refguide.

Maybe we should at least run them once per release to make sure they are still runnable as unit tests.

Yeah, trying. They are great tests. We run them variously in house on rigs (rigs come and go unfortunately but we're back at iit again). Currently my problem is that they kill all nodes in the cluster so can't make progress. Looking at making it less riotous.
Adding a miniMRCluster when configured for non-distributed mode helps. Past that, testRunFromOutputCommitter hangs.
Andrew Purtell, stack See if this patch moves things along for you in your environments.

Much better. This patch would seem to address the issue. +1

I'm letting it run. Not done yet. It is past ITI.... Got one failure but it was OOME.... will look into it:


-------------------------------------------------------

...

Yeah, I think you've addresed the 'issue' Nick Dimiduk
Adding similar logic for IntegrationTestBigLinkedList and IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify.
More +1'ing from me. This is great being able to run this in standalone.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12637974/HBASE-10830.01.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12637974

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 thanks Nick Dimiduk!

Tried running with MAVEN_OPTS="-XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC -Xmx2g" mvn failsafe:integration-test``, same issue with truncated logs and OOM:PermGen. Perhaps this investigation has moved beyond the scope of this ticket. Unless someone objects, I'll commit v01 and resolve the issue.
Nick Dimiduk +1 You fixed original issue. Now we can work on individual test failures. Good stuff.
Committed to trunk, 0.98, 0.96 branches. Thanks guys.
